programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon shows us how to make the ultimate slow cooked dishes. Recipes include caramelised figs with ricotta, phenomenal slow-cooked beef short ribs and melting beef brisket.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon teaches us to cook some of his ultimate brunches. Recipes include his irresistible spicy pancakes, a simple and delicious frittata and a fool-proof cheat's souffle with 3 cheeses.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs take the "taste it, now make it" challenge. The winners spend the day on the RMS Queen Mary.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The contestants have 45 minutes to make small dishes for the guests at a private concert.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay gives each of the final four $25 and ten minutes to find ingredients for a vegetarian dish.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The finalists have one hour to devise five dishes which will be judged by an array of top chefs.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: La Galleria 33 is an Italian restaurant managed by sisters. Ramsay must fix their menu and their finances.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay helps La Galleria 33 deal with staffing issues, menu improvements and decor renovation.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay drops by Mama Maria's, a pizzeria in Brooklyn with an exhausted owner and an unmanageable staff.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Starkville, Mississippi to try to rescue the failing Hotel Chester. Despite having over 40 years experience in the hotel business, owner David Mollendor is at a loss on how to make his dream of owning his own hotel work.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits West Dover in Vermont, to try to save a dog-friendly hotel that's desperately in need of help. Sandy MacDougall, the owner, runs the hotel like a hostel with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay sends multiple entrees back to the kitchen and temporarily kicks out one of the competing chefs.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs face off in a game of chance to divvy up their ingredients and create their own unique dishes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs are challenged to work in pairs and cook different types of fish on cedar and hickory wood planks.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The remaining chefs are given 30 minutes to create a pizza inspired by an assigned country.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon teaches you how to get started cooking amazing food with confidence. Recipes include delicious pork chops with sweet and sour peppers, pan-fried scallops with crunchy apple salad and a tip that will help you keep your knives sharp.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon teaches us how to cook with chilli. Recipes include red mullet with sweet chilli sauce, classic jerk chicken and a super simple spicy beef salad.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula pays homage to Chef Julia Child and prepares a classic Coq au vin.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Jamie Deen finally gets his pork chop as Paula prepares his favorite meal!

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Tom Berenger visits Paula for a "Major League" Flank Steak, Scalloped Potatoes that would feed a "Platoon", and Brussels Sprouts that even the "Hatfield's and McCoy's" could agree on.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Starting with a perfect pot of fluffy white rice, Martha demonstrates her techniques for a flavorful pilaf and a delicious Thai-style fried rice.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Homemade dressings don't compare to store-bought. Martha shows you how easy it is to make your own: vinaigrette, creamy blue cheese dressing, homemade mayonnaise, and aioli.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Steaming is one of the fastest and healthiest ways to cook. Martha shows how to cook in parchment paper, clean and steam mussels, and use a bamboo steamer to prepare salmon and peas.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Join Emeril and his friend Scott Maurer in the kitchen as Emeril builds an entire meal around Louisiana oysters.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Join Emeril and his friend Gabrielle Deculus in celebrating creole culture with Chicken Sauce Piquante and Creamy Grits and Grillades.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Join Emeril and his friends Maggie Long and Cyrus Lester in the kitchen as he builds a meal around the fresh and delicious mushrooms from their farm.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Dan makes foolproof swordfish skewers with tomato caponata. Becky makes Egyptian-inspired barley salad.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Dan makes the perfect Grill-Smoked and Herb-Rubbed Flat Iron Steaks and Elle makes a Fresh Fruit Tart.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Cornish Hens and Pita on the Grill
programme.desc: Julia and Bridget make gai yang and Dan makes arayes with Bridget.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Pork Chops and Corn Fritters, Perfected
programme.desc: Julia and Bridget make Pan-Seared Thick-Cut Boneless Pork Chops and Keith makes Corn Fritters.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula visits Savannah's local premiere pizza destination and becomes inspired to create a twist on breakfast.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula's daughter-in-law, Claudia, takes over Paula's kitchen once again for a vegan-inspired lunch.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Renowned Chocolatier, Adam Turoni, shows Paula the artistry of some of his most decadent chocolate creations that are easier than any cook could make.

programme.desc: Martha makes steak dinners cooked to perfection.

programme.sub-title: A Classic French Dish: Pot Au Feu

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.sub-title: The Food I Grew Up On
programme.desc: Gordon teaches us modern versions of some of the dishes he loved as a child. His mother, Helen, joins him in the kitchen to help cook a Ramsay family favourite for dinner.
